isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 3.5: CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - BAROMETRIC PRESSURE (BARO) SENSOR - ECM DIAGNOSTICS

svcprocinfo.para: The ECM continuously monitors the signal from the BARO sensor to ECM terminal 5. If the signal is out of the expected range, a fault is logged (warning light does NOT turn on) and the ECM uses the Manifold Absolute Pressure (MAP) signal generated at low idle to determine barometric pressure.

svcsubproc.title: Flash Code 151 - ATA Code PID 108 FMI 3 - ECM: baro signal out of range high
svcsubproc.para: BARO signal greater than 4.95 volts for more than 1 second.

svcsubproc.title: Flash Code 152 - ATA Code PID 108 FMI 4 - ECM: BARO SIGNAL OUT OF RANGE LOW
svcsubproc.para: BARO signal less than 1.0 volt for more than 1 second.
